activities: The use of Lennox EU employee personnel data will include, but not limited to, global enterprise headcount reporting, statistical analysis, compensation planning and related transactions, career development, staffing, training (live and web based), international personal security issues and internal investigations, safety analysis, performance management, succession planning, goal development, talent and skill identification, and employee directory.
eucountries: Belgium, Czech Republic, France, Germany, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Spain, United Kingdom
recoursemech: Lennox International Business Conduct Office will commit to cooperate with the Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) of the EU countries in the investigation and resolution of complaints and will comply with any reasonable directives given by DPAs.
